rComments: Professor Bury gives great advice and has office hours at various times so more students have a chance to visit.  He is very helpful.

Great professor. I loved this class. Bury is hilarious and always managed to drop some knowledge on us every lecture. Really expanded my view on Latin America, as well as environmental problems and possible solutions in the future. One of my favorite ENVS professors at UCSC. Highly recommended.

Bury was/is an amazing teacher. I'm upset that I took his class my last quarter, as he was by far one of my favorite teachers. Take this class if you actually want to learn, it isn't an easy A, but it is well worth the effort!!!

Jeff is super savvy, approachable, engaged with the narratives we're dealing with in this major, and has got a mean sense of humor. If you don't experience Bury, you're missing out. Pompous and intimidating? Not a chance. If you're feeling that way now, have a chat with the man--he's quite entertaining and you'll something (or a lot) too.

Jeff was somewhat wordy, and often i found that he lectured on things that had nothing to do with the topic. BUT if you go to his office hours you will realize he is a really nice guy and very funny. Dont hate the professors in this class, hate the class itself. The very idea of it is stupid, dont' take it seriously and keep up with readings!

Bury is a fantastic professor. His lectures are clear and concise with a little college humor thrown in. He's willing to help you if you ask him, and he will be generous with regrading from some of his harsh TAs. He moves at a good pace with his lectures, even if the material isn't that interesting. He does expect students to try, so try!

Great professor. His lectures were extremely interesting and informative. Yes, he is pretty pompous and intimidating, but over all he's nice. Study you notes for the midterm and final! Keep up with the reading too. Outstanding class
Great professor! He gives outstanding lectures and he's funny. Class is always interesting and informative.
Bury gives great lectures.  He is probably the most knowledgeable and intelligent professor I've had, which at times can make him incredibly intimidating.
